New Records: Mohammad Amir took 2-13 in his comeback international, helping Pakistan bowl out New Zealand for 90 runs
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan led Pakistan to 92-3 in 12.1 overs with an unbeaten 45 off 34 balls
Ben Lister made a spectacular two-handed diving catch off his follow through to dismiss Saim Ayub on 4 off the second ball of Pakistan's chase
Usman Khan was bowled by Ish Sodhi for 7 at 56-3
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized the importance of setting the tone in the first six overs in Rawalpindi
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand skipper Michael Bracewell said they didn't score quite enough runs and were slow to adapt to the surface
Pakistan captain Babar Azam praised the bowling attack saying it was outstanding
Miscellaneous Highlights: In the absence of nine frontline players at the Indian Premier League, New Zealand struggled to cope with Pakistan's experienced bowling attack
Rawalpindi will host the third game on Sunday, and the series moves to Lahore for the remaining games on April 25 and 27
